name: Cubetractor
description: WINNER: IGF China award for BEST GAME!Cubetractor is a neo-retroesque action-strategy-puzzle hybrid where you defeat enemies through an unconventional cube-pulling, turret-buildling mechanic. The game carries elements of a reverse tower defence and a grounded bullet-hell dodger to deliver a unique gameplay experience presented in a...

reviews.review_text: This is a great game. I love the pixelated art and the simple gameplay. You play as a robot and your job is to pull cubes. As the game progress you can combine cubes to make a cannon, wall, power plant, etc...  This game is quite hard too. You need to consider where you build your things to maximize your your power. To get perfect score (4 stars) you have to finish the level flawlessly (collect all the batteries, finish below the time limit and taken no damage at all).
Maybe a bit expensive for â‚¬9.99, but I'm loving the game, the puzzles, the music, the pixel art and the ridiculous conversations in game. If you like quick wit puzzle games, this is a good one!
Nice puzzle game with cute art and some times hectic moments that test your reaction speed. It was fun!

It's pretty fun i say. Disagree, you might... But, Cubetractor is pretty much a retro-ish game with happy music and the gameplay is about pulling cubes together to create towers that shoot cubes, barries and all kinds of fun stuff. The game gets harder as more enemies pop up during your adventure. There is side levels aswell, that are more like challenge levels. Keep in mind, i have not completed the game fully, so i cannot say what is there in the end etc. But overall, it's a fun experience i enjoy playing. ''It's a good timewaster'' in short. 8.5 outta 10

The combination of a slight delay needed for every input, the coordination required for building, and the fact that you take damage from everything including the blocks you use to build stuff results in an extremely frustrating underlying experience. To make matters worse, you are stopped dead anytime you take damage, and this on top of the slight delay built into the game creates a very odd start-stop style that makes coordination even more annoying and frustrating then it might've been otherwise.  Stay away unless, well, you've seen gameplay and thought 'I must play that' on sight. If you're on the fence, it's probably not worth it.
Nothing special. Overpriced. -Too casual -Repetative -Not much challenging  -Short (in around 15minutes finsihed tutorial and 5maps + 2 side maps)

I love everything about this game. A really simple but difficult to execute gameplay mechanic. Taxing puzzles. Intelligent design choices. The presentation is perfect for me as a pixel art fan. The sense of humour to the tractor dialogues is great too! I can see why this game gets rated! A steal.

Okay, when I first started this game (part of a bundle) I thought, it would be a tower defense game (I don't like them though). Turns out, this is a tower attack game. You play a robot, who is able to pull certain cubes either horziontal or vertical. Once moved they keep on moving, smashing everything in their way (critters, towers and, yes, even you). The tower part comes in, when you are able to pull two blocks on the same spot. They combine and you get a tower. Now imagine pulling blocks, while being chased by homing missles, getting attacked by critters and shot at by dozens REALLY fast shooting towers.  Yeah, I like it, but man, this game will take some time. They could've at least made the 'pull THOSE two blocks at exactly THAT spot'-excercise easier Oo'... dunno, maybe a marker for when to pull or something.

I thought this game was an action strategy game, but it is really just a straight action game. I played the first few levels, which were okay but nothing special.  When it started to get a bit harder, the difficulty was purely due to the action elements, the strategy required in the level was obvious. That might be okay, but the controls are also not great, despite being very simple.

This is game is great for maybe 90 minutes but then everything becomes much harder and then it ends rather abruptly and fairly early. This game is decent but I dont think its worth its full price and it has little replay value

This game is a cute, pixulated, boldly 2D and incredibly FUSTRATING action puzzler! Even though I was able to get this game during an indi giveaway, the 9.99$ price tag might be just a tiny bit risky for folks who don't know what to expect. If you buy and play it, grab your 360 controller and expect to have lots of fun, laugh at the cute conversations and pull your hair out..a lot of it.
it's good fun. that's basically it
it's good fun. that's basically it
This game is so much fun really basic but it is very fun.

Fun puzzle game, that gets a bit repetitive the more it goes on. The game is quite challenging, and the difficulty ramps up quickly. It is really hard to get 4 stars even on the first levels. The humor in the small vignettes before and after the levels aren't that much funny for me.
A worth experience! It is a cool puzzle game that resembles Bomberman and really let you have fun.
